commit_message:
Split off metadata vendordata plugin in own class

A recent change making nova-metadata-api work with wsgi [1] moved
the vendordata plugin parameters to the nova::metadata manifest.
While this is conceptually correct as nova-metadata is the one that
should be using this parameters. In practice the parameters are also
used in compute drivers (in the ironic driver, for instance), thats
why we should split them to be able to deploy nova-metadata-api
separate from nova-compute.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582621/

Change-Id: Ic3654c79d8cf275f0c58d57a4b66e2598450a7ed
Related-Bug: 1799352

subject: Move warnings to their own module
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-17 13:04:44.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/warning.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_enginefacade.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py', 'oslo_db/exception.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/1f0f5654a71b71aabfda862f477df0e9415080bb', 'message': "Move warnings to their own module

Raising warnings from an exception module can result in a rather
confusing message:

  Running command: '/usr/bin/nova-scheduler '
  /.../sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py:332: NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not supported
    exception.NotSupportedWarning

For someone not used to Python's 'warning' infrastructure, this can look
worse than it is, as seen at [1].

While this particular warning was resolved in change I4a5f8958c3e, it's
possible that a similar warning could be raised for other options. Best
to move this out of the 'exception' module and into something more
sensible.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1639423

Change-Id: I8e0480fb11123067a111ed6aeda6b47614615645
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Move warnings to their own module

Raising warnings from an exception module can result in a rather
confusing message:

  Running command: '/usr/bin/nova-scheduler '
  /.../sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py:332: NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not supported
    exception.NotSupportedWarning

For someone not used to Python's 'warning' infrastructure, this can look
worse than it is, as seen at [1].

While this particular warning was resolved in change I4a5f8958c3e, it's
possible that a similar warning could be raised for other options. Best
to move this out of the 'exception' module and into something more
sensible.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1639423

Change-Id: I8e0480fb11123067a111ed6aeda6b47614615645
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/10/611310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from debtcollector import moves from oslo_utils.excutils import CausedByExceptionfrom oslo_db import warningmoves.moved_class(warning.NotSupportedWarning, 'NotSupportedWarning', __name__, version='Stein') moves.moved_class(warning.OsloDBDeprecationWarning, 'OsloDBDeprecationWarning', __name__, version='Stein')
deleted_lines: from oslo_utils.excutils import CausedByExceptionclass NotSupportedWarning(Warning): """Warn that an argument or call that was passed is not supported. This subclasses Warning so that it can be filtered as a distinct category. .. seealso:: https://docs.python.org/2/library/warnings.html """ class OsloDBDeprecationWarning(DeprecationWarning): """Issued per usage of a deprecated API. This subclasses DeprecationWarning so that it can be filtered as a distinct category. .. seealso:: https://docs.python.org/2/library/warnings.html """

commit_message:
Migration step to update objects to latest version

This adds a migration step that will be executed as the last step
in the 'ironic-dbsync online_data_migration' command. It updates
all the objects that aren't in their latest version, to be in
their latest version.

Conflicts:
	ironic/cmd/dbsync.py
	ironic/db/api.py
	ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
	ironic/tests/unit/db/test_api.py

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib39319a75205ce7692f0525f99200a5de3d60a88
Story: #2004174
Task: #27656
(cherry picked from commit b8d0f2b091fe88b42ac4d0b352fd54423c5a3e2c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/66/613566/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_to_latest_versions(self, context, max_count): """Updates objects to their latest known versions. This scans all the tables and for objects that are not in their latest version, updates them to that version. :param context: the admin context :param max_count: The maximum number of objects to migrate. Must be >= 0. If zero, all the objects will be migrated. :returns: A 2-tuple, 1. the total number of objects that need to be migrated (at the beginning of this call) and 2. the number of migrated objects. """ @abc.abstractmethod

commit_message:
Add support for certs relation

Add support for rabbitmq using the certificates relation
to secure traffic with clients. Support for users supplying
their own certs and for rabbit acting as its own Certificate
Authority should be unchanged. The follwoing additional changes
were needed:

* Charm helper sync
* Update rabbit to use get_relation_ip from charm helpers which
  is the standard helper for calculating endpoint ip addresses.
* Create network helpers file to avoid circular dependancies.

Change-Id: Ie60893e660efe1f8b0a0d42aaaecfbd9aae6f97c

Future proof to allow for network spaces or other more complex addresss selection. @param config_override: string name of the config option for network override. Default to amqp-network @param interface: string name of the relation. Default to amqp. @raises Exception if prefer-ipv6 is configured but IPv6 unsupported. @returns IPv6 or IPv4 address """ fallback = get_host_ip(unit_get('private-address')) if config('prefer-ipv6'): assert_charm_supports_ipv6() return get_ipv6_addr()[0] elif config(config_override): # NOTE(jamespage) # override private-address settings if access-network is # configured and an appropriate network interface is # configured. return get_address_in_network(config(config_override), fallback) else: # NOTE(jamespage) # Try using network spaces if access-network is not # configured, fallback to private address if not # supported try: return network_get_primary_address(interface) except NotImplementedError: return fallback

commit_message:
Add cyborg-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for cyborg-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I4a180f9a1b25c75489ad3cfee30a7b55506e0bbd
Story: 2003657
Task: 26126

commit_message:
Migration step to update objects to latest version

This adds a migration step that will be executed as the last step
in the 'ironic-dbsync online_data_migration' command. It updates
all the objects that aren't in their latest version, to be in
their latest version.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib39319a75205ce7692f0525f99200a5de3d60a88
Story: #2004174
Task: #27656
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/81/613181/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_to_latest_versions(self, context, max_count): """Updates objects to their latest known versions. This scans all the tables and for objects that are not in their latest version, updates them to that version. :param context: the admin context :param max_count: The maximum number of objects to migrate. Must be >= 0. If zero, all the objects will be migrated. :returns: A 2-tuple, 1. the total number of objects that need to be migrated (at the beginning of this call) and 2. the number of migrated objects. """ @abc.abstractmethod

subject: PY3: Ensure rados.Object.read/write use byte data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-24 11:27:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_ceph.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/ceph.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/8280fa0df61be7097bf44c93338f530bbd03b7cc', 'message': 'PY3: Ensure rados.Object.read/write use byte data

rados.Object.write(string_to_write) [1] and rados.Ioctx.write(data) [2]
expect to write byte data for the above named arguments.
rados.Object.read() returns that data.

Ensure that the json_meta argument passed to rados.Object.write() in
VolumeMetadataBackup.set() is encoded as a UTF-8 bytes object and decoded
after rados.Object.read().

Also update the corresponding unit tests to ensure that metadata
dictionaries are JSON serialized, encoded, and decoded similar to
how the actual code behaves. [3]

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L3984
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L2641
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798917/comments/4

Change-Id: Idb225b5c84be3beac0c272ed4b8d69ebb04c5858
Closes-Bug: #1798917
'}]
commit_message:
PY3: Ensure rados.Object.read/write use byte data

rados.Object.write(string_to_write) [1] and rados.Ioctx.write(data) [2]
expect to write byte data for the above named arguments.
rados.Object.read() returns that data.

Ensure that the json_meta argument passed to rados.Object.write() in
VolumeMetadataBackup.set() is encoded as a UTF-8 bytes object and decoded
after rados.Object.read().

Also update the corresponding unit tests to ensure that metadata
dictionaries are JSON serialized, encoded, and decoded similar to
how the actual code behaves. [3]

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L3984
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L2641
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798917/comments/4

Change-Id: Idb225b5c84be3beac0c272ed4b8d69ebb04c5858
Closes-Bug: #1798917
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/90/612990/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: meta_obj.write(json_meta.encode('utf-8')) return meta_obj.read().decode('utf-8')

subject: Enable versioned nova notifications
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-04 21:53:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/e463d57ad2ed0275736fdc49bd9f4f0c9b6da109', 'message': 'WIP Enable versioned nova notifications

Listen for versioned notifications from Nova servers.

For now, the default nova configuration will send notifications to both
the versioned and unversioned topics, and searchlight will receive them
I think because of the way the RMQ binding works, even though the topics
are different (other nova plugins are bound to the unversioned
notifications).

To test this properly, alter the nova configuration to use only versioned
notifications. Edit nova.conf, and then restart nova API and scheduler:

  [notifications]
  notification_format: versioned

Also the versioned notifications are not entirely compatible with the
API or the old notifications; mostly notably in the network information.

Implements blueprint: nova-versioned-notifications

Change-Id: Iea3c2f19cca4b24f05b7edab4b307555fecdc1b3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-04-12 20:22:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/searchlight/commit/27ce418798f2f408cb68a4d953749f322fcd79c5', 'message': 'WIP Enable versioned nova notifications

  notification_maj_version = 1
  notification_min_version = 3

Also the versioned notifications are not entirely compatible with the

Still needs tests but otherwise working.

commit_message:
Enable versioned nova notifications

Listen for versioned notifications from Nova servers. The expected
versions for each type are coded into notification_handlers.

The versioned notifications are not entirely compatible with the
API or the old notifications; mostly notably in the network information.

Needs some functional tests as well

Change-Id: Iea3c2f19cca4b24f05b7edab4b307555fecdc1b3
Signed-off-by: Steve McLellan <steven.j.mclellan@gmail.com>
Story: #2003676
Task: #26198
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight refs/changes/52/453352/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def serialize_server_versioned(payload): # Based on currently documented 1.3 # Some transforms - maybe these could be made the same in nova? transform_keys = [('display_description', 'description'), ('display_name', 'name'), ('uuid', 'id')] for src, dest in transform_keys: payload[dest] = payload.pop(src) copy_keys = [('tenant_id', 'project_id')] for src, dest in copy_keys: if src in payload: payload[dest] = payload.get(src) delete_keys = ['audit_period', 'node'] for key in delete_keys: payload.pop(key, None) # We should denormalize this because it'd be better for searching flavor_id = payload.pop('flavor')['nova_object.data']['flavorid'] payload['flavor'] = {'id': flavor_id} image_id = payload.pop('image_uuid') payload['image'] = {'id': image_id} state_update = payload.pop('state_update', {}).get('nova_object.data') if state_update: for key in ['new_task_state', 'old_state', 'old_task_state', 'state']: payload[key] = state_update[key] else: LOG.info("State information is missing from versioned payload") # Network information. This has to be transformed # TODO(sjmc7) Try to better reconcile this with the API format ip_addresses = [address['nova_object.data'] for address in payload.pop("ip_addresses", [])] def map_address(addr): # TODO(sjmc7) Think this should be network name. Missing net type net = { "version": addr["version"], "name": addr["device_name"], "OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr": addr["mac"], } if net["version"] == 4: net["ipv4_addr"] = addr["address"] else: net["ipv6_addr"] = addr["address"] return net payload["networks"] = [map_address(address) for address in ip_addresses] return payload

commit_message:
Added downloading bitstream when programming fpga

How to test the flow of program process manually:
1. generate the fake env by the follow command
cat > ./fake_env.sh << EOL
SYSINFO=cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/sysinfo.py
UTILS=cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/utils.py
sed -i -e 's/^\(SYS_FPGA\) = "\(\/sys\/class\/fpga\)"$/\1 = "\/tmp\2"/g' $SYSINFO
sed -i -e 's/^\(SYS_FPGA_PATH\) = "\(\/sys\/class\/fpga\)"$/\1 = "\/tmp\2"/g' $UTILS
python cyborg/tests/unit/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/prepare_test_data.py
LOG=/tmp/intel_fpga_program.log
sudo echo 'echo fpgaconf \$@ '"|tee $LOG" > /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo echo "date |tee -a $LOG" >> /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo echo "echo 'Program intel FPGA successfully' |tee -a $LOG" >> /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo chmod a+x /usr/bin/fpgaconf
EOL

chmod a+x ./fake_env.sh
sudo ./fake_env.sh

2. Please use curl command as follows:
curl -s -X PATCH -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json"\
  -d '[{
    	"path": "/program",
    	"op": "replace",
    	"value": [{
    		"image_uuid": "{image_uuid}"
    	}]
  }]'\
  http://{host_ip}:6666/v1/accelerators/deployables/{deployable_uuid}/program

3. Checke the /tmp/intel_fpga_program.log it should see the infomation as
the follow exmaple:
$ cat /tmp/intel_fpga_program.log
fpgaconf -b 04 -d 00 -f 1 4047d422-5d2f-432c-b87f-5e1749e95ee6.bin
Sat Oct 27 15:08:34 UTC 2018
Program intel FPGA successfully

Change-Id: I70ff5edac65fe9e9ec1783d62c2ecd21ac5fab18

commit_message:
New Repo: OpenStack-Helm Docs

This PS adds a new repo for the OpenStack-Helm project. This
repo will house the documentation that is currently spread
throughout the openstack-helm, openstack-helm-addons and
openstack-helm-infra repos.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611893/
Change-Id: I14dca9b2b8cf68ca4ef058e19a5ee673a13bbf76
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Migration step to update objects to latest version

This adds a migration step that will be executed as the last step
in the 'ironic-dbsync online_data_migration' command. It updates
all the objects that aren't in their latest version, to be in
their latest version.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib39319a75205ce7692f0525f99200a5de3d60a88
Story: #2004174
Task: #27656
(cherry picked from commit b8d0f2b091fe88b42ac4d0b352fd54423c5a3e2c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/63/613563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def update_to_latest_versions(self, context, max_count): """Updates objects to their latest known versions. This scans all the tables and for objects that are not in their latest version, updates them to that version. :param context: the admin context :param max_count: The maximum number of objects to migrate. Must be >= 0. If zero, all the objects will be migrated. :returns: A 2-tuple, 1. the total number of objects that need to be migrated (at the beginning of this call) and 2. the number of migrated objects. """ @abc.abstractmethod

subject: Do not access the connection's socket during error callback
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-26 03:35:22.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/13759e1254ce33a4c252ae4a548be4a0e4a3b4a7', 'message': "Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1
(cherry picked from commit 361669764fd28b4f6d5f1c6896624f2da4ff5151)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1
(cherry picked from commit 361669764fd28b4f6d5f1c6896624f2da4ff5151)

commit_message:
Incremental backup completion in RBD driver

This spec proposes completely supporting incremental backup
in RBD. If the incremental flag '--incremental' is not specified,
then a new full backup will always be created.

Change-Id: Ib111e2a321db291d22ae4ab4893c3d0e0745d334
blueprint: rbd-incremental-backup-improvement
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/93/608893/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ==================================== Incremental Backup Completion In RBD ==================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/rbd-incremental-backup-improvement This spec proposes completely supporting incremental backup in RBD. If the incremental flag '--incremental' is not specified, then a new full backup will always be created. Problem description =================== Ceph RBD backend ignores the `--incremental` option when creating a volume backup. The first backup of a given volume is always a full backup, and each subsequent backup is always an incremental backup. This behavior makes it impossible to remove old backups while keeping at least one recent backup. Use Cases ========= Users can truly create a new full backup when '--incremental' is not specified. And then they can delete those old backups which are useless. Proposed change =============== The proposal is to - Change the '_backup_rbd' method in ceph backup driver, if there is no parent_id in backup object, cinder will create a new base image for full backup. - When cinder find the backup base name, use the volume.id + backup.id since now a rbd image could has more than one full backup base image. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The '--incremental' arg will work right, if user don't specify it, cinder will create full backup for rbd image. Cinder-client impact -------------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: wanghao (sxmatch1986@gmail.com) Secondary assignee: lihaijing (lihaijing@fiberhome.com) Work Items ---------- * Update RBD driver to support this feature. * Add UT tests for this change. Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Add unit tests to cover this change. Documentation Impact ==================== None. References ========== None.

commit_message:
Fix provisioning in agent when ['instance_info']['capabilities'] is unicode.

This patch introduces an extra check if ['capabilities'] are a unicode dict
and converts it to dict, before assigning the ['boot_option'] = 'local'

Change-Id: Ibaa01e04cb84d880760d239db0dc18e35b15360d
Story: 2004189

WIP: adjusting the bare minimum to get the standalone working, as
adjusting for this missing variable will require a significant amount
of work especially in the unit testing part.  I'll do it if that
solution works fine.

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which
becomes delorean url.  We don't do anything about dlrn_hash_tag_newest

This also add dlrn_hash_newest variable to be able to make proper repo
switching.

The $title is just adding the necessary bits into emit_release to take
standalone_upgrade into account.

The dlrn_hash_newest is a forgotten variable from the initial emit
release.  It has been included for standalone upgrade where the
problem first appeared, but will likely be needed for other upgrade
jobs as well when they switch to non specific release file.

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which
becomes delorean url. We don't do anything about dlrn_hash_tag_newest
which becomes RDO_DLRN_REPO which becomes delorean-current.

This means that when we are upgrading we get the dlrn_hash_tag_newest
that was defined in the previous run, ie during deployment.

Change-Id: I0e298fc37eb7b3fd0afaa13ab021330b789b2f5e
Closes-Bug: #1795367

commit_message:
Add standalone upgrade to emit release.

This also add dlrn_hash_newest variable to be able to make proper repo
switching.

The $title is just adding the necessary bits into emit_release to take
standalone_upgrade into account.

The dlrn_hash_newest is a forgotten variable from the initial emit
release.  It has been included for standalone upgrade where the
problem first appeared, but will likely be needed for other upgrade
jobs as well when they switch to non specific release file.

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which
becomes delorean url. We don't do anything about dlrn_hash_tag_newest
which becomes RDO_DLRN_REPO which becomes delorean-current.

This means that when we are upgrading we get the dlrn_hash_tag_newest
that was defined in the previous run, ie during deployment.

Change-Id: I0e298fc37eb7b3fd0afaa13ab021330b789b2f5e
Closes-Bug: #1795367

added_lines: $STANDALONE_DEPLOY_RELEASE $STANDALONE_DEPLOY_HASH \ $STANDALONE_DEPLOY_NEWEST_HASH) $STANDALONE_TARGET_RELEASE $STANDALONE_TARGET_HASH $STANDALONE_TARGET_NEWEST_HASH)

commit_message:
Use container_build_id for standalone containers

The container_build_id is set by the container-prep role with multiple
fallbacks, we have to use the same value for the
standalone-container-prep.sh tag value

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/251?kanban-status=1447276

Change-Id: I908d5d8d218e49f3ae3c2d4cf89295ce2d260004

commit_message:
Change log directory for OpenDaylight

OpenDaylight karaf logs are currently stored in
/var/log/containers/opendaylight/karaf.log.

There is a logrotate_crond container job, that will
rotate any *.log in /var/log/containers, with this
pattern:

/var/log/containers/*/*log /var/log/containers/*/*/*log {
  daily
 ....
}

OpenDaylight is Java code, and has it's own logrotate
mechanism alreay configured. Currently, we have 2 entities
doing log rotation, tripleO logrotate_crond, and ODL Pax
logging. These 2 don't play nicely together.

This patch will move the ODL logs out of the path
of the tripleO log rotate cron job, so that ODL can
manage it's own log rotation.

Another option would be to modify tripleO to explicitly
list out all of the containers, and only do log rotation
for those listed.

Closes-Bug:#1793566

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1793566

Change-Id: I8acf7db248bf31d3010bc0313f48812a244d1004
Signed-off-by: Victor Pickard <vpickard@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d520016ff827fb309a5935c2c7189bb5a2bc4bf1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/68/612468/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes openDaylight karaf file log rotation by changing karaf log rollover parameters in PAX logging configuration. Reference https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/#/c/75480/ for more details. Also, moves openDaylight karaf log file location to /var/log/containers/opendaylight/karaf/logs/karaf.log. Reference https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603907/ for more details.

commit_message:
Parametrize OpenShift deployment type

This prevents hardcoding it in the template and allows to check for the
right service name during new node detection as origin and
openshift-enterprise deployment types use differnt prefixes for the
services.

Change-Id: Id5cf7d6f7888b759eec7c969275fe15779b7b775

commit_message:
Don't install setuptools/pip/virtualenv from RPMs

Openstack infra has them already installed and we are not supose to
install it, for example at fedora the exclude them explitcitly from the
dnf.conf

Change-Id: I3b276e159ff7534777219975995fc20c967d0e42

commit_message:
[queens-only] include local_ip & undercloud_admin_host in docker_insecure_registries

This patch includes by default the local_ip and undercloud_admin_host in
docker_insecure_registries parameter, that can be missed but actually
needed in some cases.

This code was done in tripleoclient for the containerized undercloud in
Rocky, so we just need to port it here for stable versions, to have the
same behavior.

Change-Id: I03be8381ec776fd769139c79b85470acedc64d2b
Closes-Bug: #1799784

commit_message:
Fixed stackviz report for standalone

* When Moving 'stackviz to /var/log/extra/stackviz' task is called,
  /var/log/extra/stackviz directory does not exist which leads to
  failure giving no such directory in order to fix that we need
  to check whether destination exists or not. If not first create
  it and then move the content and also make sure stackviz-export
  operation has successfully completed.

Change-Id: Ie84c150c74363da25e76bbb234a864a72c6c366a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/18/612618/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: register: stackviz_result shell: > set -o pipefail if [ ! -d /var/log/extra/stackviz ]; then mkdir -p /var/log/extra/stackviz fi mv {{ working_dir }}/stackviz/ /var/log/extra/stackviz when: stackviz_result.stats.rc == 0

commit_message:
Backend validation for extra spec options

Spec to propose a new API for validating volume type extra spec
options by volume backend drivers.

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint volume-type-extra-spec-validation
Change-Id: I65f199dcdeccbc50130469c114f5ec5d5e12fca9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/76/318576/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Volume Type Extra Spec Validation ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/volume-type-extra-spec-validation The purpose of this spec is to propose a new API for validating volume type extra spec options by volume backend drivers. This would improve the user experience while creating or updating volume type extra spec options. Problem description =================== Currently the extra spec options in volume types are not validated by volume backend drivers while creating or updating it. The extra spec options are validated during volume create or attach depending on the option and the volume backend. For example, the VMware VMDK driver supports the extra spec option 'vmware:storage_profile' which specifies the storage policy to be associated with the volume in vCenter server. If the storage policy provided by the admin is invalid, an error will be thrown by the VMDK driver during volume creation, which is not a good user experience. Use Cases ========= * Admin creating or updating one or more extra spec options. The admin configures the backend, and creates/updates volume type extra spec options to map it to options in the backend. If there is a typo, it will be discovered only during volume create or attach operation, which is not a good user experience. * The end-user may not be able to create a volume or attach it if the admin did not validate the volume type extra spec options. Proposed change =============== The user experience would be better if there is an API to validate the extra spec options by the backend identified by the volume_backend_name option in the volume type. After creating or updating the extra spec option, the admin will invoke the API, which in-turn calls a new driver API (validate_extra_spec) to validate the extra spec options. The driver is expected to verify all options which it uses during create or attach, and if one or more options are invalid, the driver will raise an exception containing a dictionary which maps invalid keys to corresponding reject reason. If the API returns an error, the admin will correct the extra spec options based on the error message. If the volume_backend_name is empty, the validation will be NOP. The validation will fail if the backend identified by volume_backend_name is not available. The default implementation of validate_extra_spec driver API will be NOP. Alternatives ------------ * The admin can create a test volume, and attach to an instance. The user experience would be better if the admin can validate the extra spec by running a specific command. * We can add the validation logic to the API for updating the extra spec. But this also requires a new driver API to validate the extra spec. Also, the validation will not be possible if the volume_backend_name is added later or the backend is down. In the latter case, the extra spec cannot be updated if the backend is not available, which is not the case currently. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- The following API will be added: * POST /v3/​{tenant_id}​/types/​{volume_type_id}​/action Normal response code 200 JSON request { "os-extra_spec_validate": {} } JSON response { "invalid_extra_spec_options": { "key1" : "value1 is invalid", "key4" : "value4 does not exist" } } Expected error http response code(s) 400 - one or more extra spec options are invalid Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The python-cinderclient will be updated to support the new extra spec validate API. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- If the driver requires backend validation of extra spec, it should override the default implementation of validate_extra_spec. The driver should validate all extra spec options it care about. If one or more options are invalid, it should raise an exception containing a dictionary which maps invalid keys to reject reasons. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vbala Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- * cinder-api and cinder-volume changes to implement the new API * python-cinderclient changes to invoke the new API from command line * VMDK driver changes to implement validate_extra_spec driver API Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit tests will be added to cover the changes Documentation Impact ==================== The API reference should be updated to include details about the new API. Also, the cinder client documentation should be updated to add the new command. References ========== None

commit_message:
Add sphinx extension to document policies/profiles

This change adds a sphinx extention to build sections of the policy and
profile documentation from source code.

- Add new extension
- Modify contributor documentation for policies to show spec fields
  from source code
- Modify user documentation for policies and profiles to show properties
  from source code
- Modify user documentation for policies and profiles to include
  samples extracted from examples directory
- Update tox to run pep8 against sphinx extension

Change-Id: I32f68867d14c3288385dbdf3b4df14e8ca2fd01f

commit_message:
Summary should be a one liner

Without this change twine check dist/* would fail as this was
producing a double new line. The rest of the PKG-INFO would then
be interpreted as the message body and become the long
description. See https://github.com/pypa/twine/issues/422 for
more details.

This fixes the test-release-openstack-python3 zuul job.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If1330c4824e949aa427475dfcc26218fb398a66e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/30/613930/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I8b0bcd14640449db2d03f1a55d94b5d12e64c39d
Story: #2004073
Task: #27432

subject: Fix DHCPv6 support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-18 13:14:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/98408d269e6c99226ede9dd1654812b1b8a8ef16', 'message': 'Fix DHCPv6 support

Adds logic to handle the appropriate replies for DHCPv6
responses.

The IPv6 nature was discovered while researching differences
and finding that the field ID value changes between IPv4 and
IPv6 DHCP clients, as DHCPv6 is purely booting from a URL.

Change-Id: I63572bea9bfb150aaeb4708dfa57e71adf4f64ab
Task: 9788

commit_message:
Fix DHCPv6 support

Adds logic to handle the appropriate replies for DHCPv6
responses.

The IPv6 nature was discovered while researching differences
and finding that the field ID value changes between IPv4 and
IPv6 DHCP clients, as DHCPv6 is purely booting from a URL.

Change-Id: I63572bea9bfb150aaeb4708dfa57e71adf4f64ab
Task: 9788
Story: 1744620
Story: 2003934

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-27 17:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['test-log-collect.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/commit/693cab78e1fe056e7e6372c63d31273f85256c0e', 'message': 'test-log-collect: Improve rsync performance for log collection

When collecting logs we do not care about file deltas so we can use
the --whole-file option to not perform any kind of diff between the
source and the destination. The --inplace option can also improve

Change-Id: I044cd2d56b9b907e5948be1d3bd11ce4a876b1a2

commit_message:
test-log-collect: Improve rsync performance for log collection

When collecting logs we do not care about file deltas so we can use
the --whole-file option to not perform any kind of diff between the
source and the destination. The --inplace option can also improve
performance by copying files directly on the destination instead of
creating intermediate ones first.

Change-Id: I044cd2d56b9b907e5948be1d3bd11ce4a876b1a2
(cherry picked from commit 592cb54d3c5b5251b421de290dbde6dbba5e6c61)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/54/613754/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export RSYNC_CMD="rsync --archive --safe-links --ignore-errors --quiet --no-perms --no-owner --no-group --whole-file --inplace"

commit_message:
Add spec: os-net-config-impl-nmcli (os-net-config NetworkManager CLI)

This spec describes the proposal to add support for the NetworkManager
CLI to os-net-config. This will allow network configuration for
Atomic hosts, since Atomic does not support traditional network
configuration files in /etc.

Change-Id: I4695d107eb946f61edc6ac7fac6980d7c90b8f7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/72/418172/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Example Spec - The title of your blueprint ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/os-net-config-impl-nmcli The os-net-config utility currently supports two different implementations of network configuration. The impl_ifcfg implementation writes out ifcfg- and route- files to /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts, while the impl_eni writes out the /etc/network/interfaces configuration file. An Atomic host is a container host with minimal user environment. There are no /etc/network/interfaces or /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts directories, instead network configuration must be done with ``nmcli`` commands. Problem Description =================== To support full containerization for TripleO deployments, we will be making changes to the deployment hosts. Initially, this will involve taking full OS builds and enabling containers on those hosts. Eventually, we will want to be able to take advantage of dedicated container hosts such as Atomic, since they have a reduced memory footprint and a reduced security attack surface. Atomic hosts require a different configuration from standard Linux hosts. Instead of ifcfg files or a single /etc/network/interfaces file, Atomic hosts must be configured using ``nmcli``. Proposed Change =============== The architecture of os-net-config supports pluggable implementation modules. Currently only impl_eni (for Debian-based systems) and impl_ifcfg (for Fedora- based systems (including CentOS and RHEL). A new os-net-config implementation (``impl_nmcli``) will be created. Overview -------- Atomic hosts can use nmcli commands to enable networking, or DBus may be used to issue commands to NetworkManager. In order to support this approach, a new provider will be created in os-net-config. This provider, impl_nmcli, will accept the same input templates, but will run the proper ``nmcli`` commands to configure the network instead of writing configuration files to /etc/. Alternatives ------------ There is more than one way to configure NetworkManager, and we could configure TripleO with Heat templates and/or Puppet to write out a script to issue the proper ``nmcli`` commands. This would accomplish the same goal, but it wouldn't be backwards-compatible with non-Fedora systems. By using os-net-config for this purpose, we avoid having to create separate configuration templates for containers than we do for baremetal or virtual hosts, and maintain support for Debian-based systems in TripleO. We also take advantage of any work done to make the network configuration automatically generated. Security Impact --------------- The security architecture is often reliant on a secure networking configuration. This is one of the main motivations behind isolated networking in the first place. We need to ensure that when the network interfaces are configured, that static IPs are used instead of DHCP. We also need to ensure that when using IPv6 we disable DHCPv6 and accepting RA (Router Advertisement) announcments and disable SLAAC address autoconfiguration unless specifically enabled. This ensures that IPv6 traffic cannot be hijacked by rogue RA messages or rogue DHCPv6. Other End User Impact --------------------- Are there ways a user will interact with this feature? Performance Impact ------------------ So far we have been avoiding the use of NetworkManager because it didn't support OVS configuration. Because of that, we don't have any testing data to show if there are performance impacts. It is expected that NetworkManager will result in a configuration functionaly similar to that using configuration files in the current operation. There isn't a strong dependency on how quickly a configuration can be applied, since it is a tiny fraction of the overall deployment time. No negative performance impact is expected. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- The network interface configuration files should be identical whether the new NetworkManager backend is used, so the deployment workflow will not change. There may be some impact on the troubleshooting, but it is expected that troubleshooting will be significantly different in a fully containerized deployment. Developer Impact ---------------- Developers who write patches for os-net-config will now have to target features to an additional implementation. It would be best if the new subclass substantially followed the coding style and design patterns of the existing implementations in order to make modifications easier. Implementation ============== The new class will be named ``os_net_config.impl_nmcli``. It will implement the same methods implented by the other implementations, ``impl_ifcfg`` and ``impl_eni``. Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: dsneddon@redhat.com Other contributors: bfournie@redhat.com Work Items ---------- * Create ``os_net_config.impl_nmcli`` and implement methods including apply(). * Create stub methods for capturing output that would be sent to ``nmcli``. * Create unit tests for new implementation. Dependencies ============ In order for ``nmcli`` to work for our needs, it will first need to support Open vSwitch as a configuration target. The requirement has been communicated to the NetworkManager team, who have committed to providing support, although no time estimate is available yet. Testing ======= The module will require unit tests to ensure that all configuration options are implemented properly. It will also require integration testing to ensure that NetworkManger is doing the right things with the commands it is given. Documentation Impact ==================== We will need to document any differences between what is supported in the other impelentations and what the ``impl_nmcli`` supports. We will also have to document any peculiarities that arise from doing networking within the container on a suitable host. References ========== * TBD

commit_message:
apparmor: Allow cgroup v2 mounts

Previously, only the v1 of the cgroup fs was being allowed by AppArmor
and this were causing problems like the following one

 audit: type=1400 audit(1540571957.300:196): apparmor="DENIED"
 operation="mount" info="failed type match" error=-13
 profile="lxc-container-default-cgns" name="/sys/fs/cgroup/unified/"
 pid=26738 comm="systemd" fstype="cgroup2" srcname="cgroup" flags="rw,
 nosuid, nodev, noexec"

Change-Id: I7f6ac8af0bc1c7d9844ee0c3505b65894d3b7aa1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/74/613874/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mount fstype=cgroup2 -> /sys/fs/cgroup/**,

commit_message:
Skip the services with no endpoints when parsing service catalog

When parsing the service catalog to find the source, audit middleware
should skip over the services which have no endpoints instead of
assuming they will have at least one endpoint.

Change-Id: I287873e99338d95baaf20d52ecb3a43763a401fc
Closes-Bug: #1800017
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/10/613410/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | [:bug:`1800017`] Fix audit middleware service catalog parsing for the scenario where a service does not contain any endpoints. In that case, we should just skip over that service.

commit_message:
Add permanent ARP entries for DVR fip/qrouter veth pair

Since we know the IP and MAC addresses of both sides of the
fip/qrouter namespace veth pair device, just add permanent
ARP entries for them.

Change-Id: I6193b00681dfb79222eedfd00c89620321ac1b4f
Related-Bug: #1791989
(cherry picked from commit ac5815a110f0033c1a217481822fc0c72c1ba16c)

Add doc depends to tox releasenotes environment

When I run "tox -e releasenotes" it fails because it doesn't install
any of the sphinx or reno tools.  Add doc dependencies.

commit_message:
Call pre/post run task calls from TaskManager.submit_task()

Since I33325fb5be21264df0a68ceef2202ab7875f63ec, the task.run() call
in TaskManager.run_task() is now an asynchronous submission to the
threadpool, rather than a synchronous call to the task's actual
function.  This means taking the elapsed_time around this call is no
longer an indication of the task's runtime, but always comes out as
just a few μs for the insertion.

Move the pre and post calls into TaskManager.submit_task() where the
elapsed_time will reflect the time between insertion into the queue
and the wait() return of its result.

Update documentation for pre/post tasks, and add test-cases.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613438
Change-Id: I8617ab2895d1544a6902ae5a3d6a97b87bfd2ec9

commit_message:
Allow streaming raw partition images

This change removes the safeguard that prevented the partition images
from being converted to the raw format when HTTP is used as a source.

Task: #26567

subject: Reword open source definition in the Four Opens
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-29 11:49:22.000000000', 'files': ['reference/opens.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/commit/62ff3381c5cd096423f18936d1753f4ce592c737', 'message': 'Reword open source definition in the Four Opens

The current phrasing states "Truly open source software is not feature
or performance limited and is not crippled."

Crippled in that context means it is not disabled or limited in any
manner by the fact the software is open source. As a non-native English
speaker, the first impression on looking up that adjective on the
internet is that it is an English word used to describe people with
disabilities, sometimes in a pejorative manner. Its translation to the
Portuguese word 'aleijado' which does not seem respectful, translating
back to 'crippled', 'lame' or 'gammy'.

As it led me to confusion, it may lead others too, specially in a
community where almost every country in this planet is represented.

This patch suggests the removal of that part of the sentence, leaving
"Truly open source software is not feature or performance limited."
which still has the same meaning that is clear and thus does not need
to be emphasized by that adjective.

Change-Id: I29b6cea609ae9db9c9ff678c28744de4570486ca
'}]
commit_message:
Reword open source definition in the Four Opens

The current phrasing states "Truly open source software is not feature
or performance limited and is not crippled."

Crippled in that context means it is not disabled or limited in any
manner by the fact the software is open source. As a non-native English
speaker, the first impression on looking up that adjective on the
internet is that it is an English word used to describe people with
disabilities, sometimes in a pejorative manner. Its translation to the
Portuguese word 'aleijado' which does not seem respectful, translating
back to 'crippled', 'lame' or 'gammy'.

As it led me to confusion, it may lead others too, specially in a
community where almost every country in this planet is represented.

This patch suggests the removal of that part of the sentence, leaving
"Truly open source software is not feature or performance limited."
which still has the same meaning that is clear and thus does not need
to be emphasized by that adjective.

Change-Id: I29b6cea609ae9db9c9ff678c28744de4570486ca

commit_message:
Improve volume transfer records

This spec proposes to improve volume transfer records by
adding ``original_project_id`` and ``current_project_id``,
``accept`` fields to ``transfer`` table and related api
responses, makes it easier for users to trace and audit the
volume transfer history.

Change-Id: Ia6f1824f44a6297fc3696bdf4a86f0d0758583c6
Blueprint: improve-volume-transfer-records
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/66/612866/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================================================== Improve volume transfer records ======================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/improve-volume-transfer-records This blueprint proposes to improve volume transfer records by adding ``original_project_id`` and ``current_project_id``, ``accept`` fields to ``transfer`` table and related api responses, makes it easier for users to trace the volume transfer history. Problem description =================== Current, the volume transfer record does not include the current project_id after transferring and the original project_id before transferring, these fields are very useful for admins and operators to trace the transfer trajectory. And also once the transfer is deleted, the user can't get this transfer had been accepted or not before it was deleted. It is bad for admins and users to trace volume historical track between project and audit the volume records. Use Cases =================== * In order to trace the volume transfer history, the admin wants to know who was the volume owner before transferring. * The admin wants to know a deleted transfer had been accepted or not. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes to add a three fields: * ``original_project_id``, this field records the original project_id before volume transferring. * ``current_project_id``, this field records the current project_id after volume transferring. * ``accept``, this field records the this transfer is accepted or not. Alternatives ------------ The admins could find part of volume transferring info from log, but it's difficult to find it out easily, especially when the user wants to audit a very old volume transfer. REST API impact --------------- A new microversion will be created to add these new added field to transfer related API responses. Data model impact ----------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- Notifications will be changed to add these new added fields. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- * Add ``original_project_id`` and ``current_project_id``, ``accept`` fields to ``transfer`` table * Add ``original_project_id`` and ``current_project_id``, ``accept`` fields to related API. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Unit-tests, tempest and other related test should be implemented Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Drop strict-order flag from dnsmasq invocation

Without this flag, dnsmasq prefers to ask the servers that
are known to be up, rather than hitting servers that are either
down or known to be broken. This greatly reduces responsivity
impact of broken upstream servers.

Closes-Bug: #1746000
Change-Id: Ieee4dafc578c3bda0935fcdb80faad6c342a10e9
(cherry picked from commit d3c69dc4f22ef96ad3fb66430ce703d9c2199d2e)

Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

* Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
  in the check queue only. Remove individual cover jobs.
* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.

Change-Id: I5945969c4afbb61fc97271ed09dad61e0c96ae62

commit_message:
Fix unit tests with py3.6

In python3.6 the path used by os.path.join can be either
a string or bytes, so mock the neutron.common.config.init
to return a string so the tests pass with python3.6.

commit_message:
hpe 3par driver initialization failure

do_setup call fails if the stats passed has the missing
array_id, in such cases it should use the client login
to fetch the array_id information.

Change-Id: I36d75fbe18770d6e3ae03c05d5392f8141082a0f
Closes-bug: #1790005

commit_message:
Add permanent ARP entries for DVR fip/qrouter veth pair

Since we know the IP and MAC addresses of both sides of the
fip/qrouter namespace veth pair device, just add permanent
ARP entries for them.

Change-Id: I6193b00681dfb79222eedfd00c89620321ac1b4f
Related-Bug: #1791989
(cherry picked from commit ac5815a110f0033c1a217481822fc0c72c1ba16c)

commit_message:
Storwize: modify hyperswap host_site configuration

The new configuration storwize_preferred_host_site was introduced in
volume type for hyperswap feature on Queens release. Actually, the
host_site is related to host rather than volume.

This patch removes the parameter storwzie_preferred_host_site from
volume type configuration and updates it from StrOpt to DictOpt in cinder
back-end configuration.

Closes-Bug:  1742866

Change-Id: Ie1df4cc45c2d1f72f33beea7ddc5bb3797a34728
(cherry picked from commit b13a8f810b143f5f0f465ab45eab453c1e65de7d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/79/577079/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add the following to the back-end configuration to specify the host preferred site for hyperswap volume. FC: .. code-block:: ini storwize_preferred_host_site = site1:20000090fa17311e&ff00000000000001, site2:20000089762sedce&ff00000000000000 iSCSI: .. code-block:: ini storwize_preferred_host_site = site1:iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:eac5ccc1aaa&iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:be53b7e236be, site2:iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:eac5ccc1bbb&iqn.1993-08.org.debian:01:abcdefg9876w The site1 and site2 are names of the two host sites used in Storwize storage. The WWPNs and IQNs are the connectors used for host mapping in Storwize. drivers:peer_pool=Pool_site2

commit_message:
Add neutron-load-balancer interface

The Neutron built-in LBaaS provider is deprecated as of
OpenStack version Queens and the service is to be replaced
by a separate service such as Octavia.

This interface serves the purpose of notifying a external
load balancer service of when the Neutron API is ready to
accept queries.

In a transition period it is also used by the ``neutron-api``
charm to determine whether it should configure Neutron with
the legacy LBaaS provider enabled or if it should enable
the ``lbaasv2-proxy`` driver to proxy load balancer requests
sent to the Neutron API to the external service.

Change-Id: Id9f7ffb3d363c7606d92af592b9803644046d865

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I0060c6ff2c29ea8dd3f2ff5c037dab234860dfa9

commit_message:
[WIP] Add Swift Chart

A helm chart for OpenStack Swift.
This patchset doesn't include day 2 operations like ongoing
ring management, node addition or subtraction, which will be
added in a future patchset.

Change-Id: I8770184336321d4cf163d0de582175de66089a9f

name: sahara-db-init image: {{ .Values.images.db_init }} imagePullPolicy: {{ .Values.images.pull_policy }} {{- if .Values.resources.enabled }} resources: limits: cpu: {{ .Values.resources.jobs.init.limits.cpu | quote }} memory: {{ .Values.resources.jobs.init.limits.memory | quote }} requests: cpu: {{ .Values.resources.jobs.init.requests.cpu | quote }} memory: {{ .Values.resources.jobs.init.requests.memory | quote }} {{- end }} env: - name: ROOT_DB_CONNECTION valueFrom: secretKeyRef: name: sahara-db-root key: DB_CONNECTION - name: OPENSTACK_CONFIG_FILE value: /etc/sahara/sahara-api.conf - name: OPENSTACK_CONFIG_DB_SECTION value: database - name: OPENSTACK_CONFIG_DB_KEY value: connection command: - python - /tmp/db-init.py volumeMounts: - name: sahara-bin mountPath: /tmp/db-init.py subPath: db-init.py readOnly: true - name: etcsahara mountPath: /etc/sahara - name: sahara-etc mountPath: /etc/sahara/sahara.conf subPath: sahara.conf readOnly: true volumes: - name: etcsahara emptyDir: {} - name: sahara-etc configMap: name: sahara-etc - name: sahara-bin configMap: name: sahara-bin defaultMode: 0555

commit_message:
Driver reinitialization after failure

This is a proposal to reinitialize a volume driver
when it fails during starting.

Change-Id: I99d047da270a28adb1b303af4c5140d678e1065d
Implements: blueprint driver-initialization-after-fail
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/05/599505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== Driver reinitialization after failure ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/driver-initialization-after-fail This spec proposes support for reintialization of volume drivers after it fails during startup. Problem description =================== When a service starts, at first it does initialization. If something wrong happens, the service ends. After initialization completes, it cleans up resources, initializes its driver and RPC servers. Later the volume service reports its capability to scheduler in fixed intervals. During above progress, some errors lead that a volume service process exists but its volume driver doesn't work. 1) Driver not supported. 2) Driver initialization fails. 3) Volume cleanups are processed by parent class CleanableManager. 4) Something wrong with 'publish_service_capabilities' [2]. Driver are not set as initialized in above case 1), 2) and 3). As a result, although the volume service process exists, and tries to publish its service capabilities to scheduler, but fails every time. This means users have to restart cinder volume to re-initialize drivers. When case 4 happens the volume service moves on and can become available if it succeeds to publish its service to scheduler next time. Use Cases ========= When a Cinder volume service starts, its corresponding storage service is not ready. But later the storage service becomes ready. As a result the volume service can't work properly and can't recover by itself. Proposed change =============== The proposal is to - Every time when a volume service publishes its capability to scheduler, it calls init_host[1] if the volume driver is not set to initialized. For this, the following additional config options would be needed: - 'reinit_on_failure' (default: 'False') If set as true, the volume service reinitializes its driver if it is not initialized. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None. Cinder-client impact -------------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- Users don't need to restart volume service when the initialization of drivers fail. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Lisa Li (xiaoyan.li@intel.com) Work Items ---------- * Add the option 'reinit_on_failure'. * Reinitialize volume drivers in 'publish_service_capabilities' [2]. * Add related unit testcases. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= * Add unit tests to cover this change. Documentation Impact ==================== * Add administrator documentation to advertise the option of 'reinit_on_failure' for driver reinitialization and explain why&when&how this should be used. References ========== _`[1]`: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/manager.py#L408 _`[2]`: https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/manager.py#L2539

commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I9338a3732e92cf04c57c61e4a04a25305a6133e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack refs/changes/89/609189/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: stestr run {posargs}

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-10-16 02:51:00.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/instack/commit/f63f9aee03c2c556cbb0d27b37a9bbc9d337bb35', 'message': "Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that

to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

commit_message:
Change python3.5 job to python3.7 job on Stein+

This is a mechanically generated patch to add a unit test job running
under Python 3.7 and drop the Python 3.5 unit test job.

python3.5 was the only supported python3 version on Xenial. Now that
we have Bionic nodes supporting python3.6 and python3.7, let's switch
to testing with python3.7 in addition to python3.6 in Stein and
beyond.

See ML discussion here [1] for context.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135626.html

Change-Id: I21b6a57892fc7ec6e64e436597608e494478cef6
Story: #2004073
Task: #27459
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack refs/changes/93/610793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - openstack-python37-jobs

commit_message:
New Repo - OpenStack-Helm Images

This PS adds a new repo for the OpenStack-Helm project. This
repo will house the dockerfiles that are spread throughout the
openstack-helm, openstack-helm-addons and openstack-helm-infra
repos.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611892
Change-Id: I50d43a0f4511c361941aab286ed8ce068ad2ddb0
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Ensure namespace and network policy compatibility

This patch ensures namespace handler does not depend on specific
functions implemented on the security group driver for the namespace
isolation. This way it will be possible to enable the namespace
handler (to create a different network per namespace) together with
the network policy that will perform the isolation between pods/svc
in a different way.

Partially Implements: blueprint k8s-network-policies
Closes-Bug: #1799496
Change-Id: Ied892e616075ce16fdc15ceb31219c100e011536
(cherry picked from commit 651da66af1191053a96b283aa6d890fd8488438d)

commit_message:
Retire project Anchor - Step 5

This change follows step 5 from the manual[0] for retiring a
project by removing anchor from the list of maintained
projects by the Security SIG.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: I6b848e4bccaf8a713be60ab52ec1668934a70653

commit_message:
Import puppet-crane

This puppet module provides a way to configure Crane (a lightweight
docker pull API).

The intent is to use this as an option for TripleO underclouds.

Depends-On: Ifdc403ca0faa57e61359707a5fc25a9dfa20e031
Change-Id: I897ce8b601bda54b0334eefbd8879e2587ee5515

commit_message:
Allow more complex cells setup

Refactored simple_cell_setup.yml (renamed cell_setup.yml) to perform
different functions based on whether "cell_specifications" exists in
scope and was written to passwords.yml.  Also adds the ability to
deploy this to a nova hypervisor without making cell changes.

This depends on the nova patch that adds apply_cells action to
the nova-manage CLI.

Co-Authored-By: David Bingham <dbingham@godaddy.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kris Lindgren <klindgren@godaddy.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jeffrey Fasenfest <jfasenfest@godaddy.com>

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568987/
Change-Id: If147465e4be78247ac1deed7facc823328eb23ae

added_lines: # Simple cell setup - map_cell0 is success # Simple cell setup - base_cell is success when: cell_specifications is not defined - name: Create cell mappings from specs # Automated cell_specifications setup command: > docker exec nova_api nova-manage cell_v2 apply_cells --cell-specs-file /etc/nova/cell_specifications.yaml register: apply_cells changed_when: - apply_cells is success - '"changes applied to your cells" in apply_cells.stdout' run_once: True delegate_to: "{{ groups['nova-api'][0] }}" when: cell_specifications is defined - include: bootstrap_service.yml vars: nova_api: "{{ nova_services['nova-conductor'] }}" nova_bootstrap_image: "{{ nova_services['nova-api'].image }}" nova_bootstrap_delegate_host: "{{ groups[item.rabbitmq_group][0] }}" with_items: "{{ cells }}" when: apply_cells.changed

commit_message:
Remove references to log translation functions

No new implementers of this library should be using the log-oriented
marker functions, so we shouldn't be providing examples of them.
This change removes them from the sample integration module and
updates the usage examples to reflect the current best practices.

Change-Id: I0ae89cb3500821465438ee1f5572ab5e3573044c

commit_message:
DVR: Add IPv6 csnat port address correctly

If router gateway info update, in l3_dvr_db will receive events,
We will get subnets from router attached DVR port, if exists
multiple IPv6 slaac-enabled subnets, previous code will create
csnat port form one of the IPv6 subnets.
This is inconsistency with router interface
udpate in _update_snat_v6_addrs_after_intf_update.

This patch adds all IPv6 subnets if the distributed
router port have multiple IPv6 subnets.

Change-Id: I02ffed238897ebc91b96aebb7f94ed90b7613769
Closes-Bug: #1786169
(cherry picked from commit c6aac9041f98f971cd1362bee2768a04bbe5cf1d)

commit_message:
Fix home direcroty path in trovestack script

This simple fix solves "no such file or directory" error when user
home directory is not prefixed by /home.

This is the case, for example in devstack, where stack user home is
set to /opt/stack/.

Lets use $HOME variable to determine user home location.

Change-Id: I07432d27e1a2035296bc62793fecbe13d0265e7b
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/62/613662/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix dvr ha router gateway goes wrong host

During L3 agent restart, the dvr ha router gateway port
binding host may change because the multiple ha router
scheduled hosts.

After this patch, we return the 'master' ha binding host
directly during the gateway port create. And do not let
the original 'master' (current is backup) host override
the gateway port binding host.

Closes-Bug: #1793529
Change-Id: Icb2112c7f0bd42c4f4b1cf32d6b83b6d97f85ef7

commit_message:
Fix incorrect test_group in zull job definition

Both of mysql trove-scenario jobs performed the same tests
group (mysql-supported-single).

This change sets correct group for trove-scenario-mysql-multi job.

Furthermore, to be consistent, trove_test_datastore has been passed
explicite for trove-scenario-mysql-single job.

Change-Id: I377e17ebf690c79d1c369116697177f992b3df65
Signed-off-by: Marcin Piwowarczyk <m.piwowarczy@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Automating generation of API doc sample files

Nova has implemented the method of generating sample files using
functional tests which records API responses in api sample files,
matches and updates if any mismatch occurs, which makes it quite
easier to keep the documentation up to date.
This spec proposes implementing the same idea in cinder.

Change-Id: I5eef2ab6cd03747c972a3c19d0666e053af44270
blueprint: generating-sample-files
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder-specs refs/changes/49/613949/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== Automating generation of sample files ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/generating-sample-files Problem description =================== Cinder api-ref doc is constructed without the help of any sample request or response parameters which makes it error prone. Monitoring every change in the existing API response parameters is quite difficult and that causes the api-ref to contain old parameters. Use Cases ========= Generating the response parameters from latest API functionality will help keep the api-ref document up to date. Proposed change =============== The generation will occour at two locations : * doc/api_samples - samples for API reference docs * cinder/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples - templates or abstract structure of response without any actual values. It is similar to api samples structurally. The generation of files on the above two stated locations will be done by implementing api sample functional tests. Alternatives ------------ Manually execute commands and match the response with the current api-ref doc parameters. REST API impact --------------- None Data model impact ----------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Can generate API reference doc samples from templates by running tests using the following command `tox -r -e api-samples` Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: whoami-rajat <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com> Work Items ---------- * Implement API Sample functional tests Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= None Documentation Impact ==================== The api-ref docs will be updated by taking reference from the sample doc files generated. References ========== _`[1]`: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/contributor/api.html#functional-tests-and-api-samples
